72c25259-b199-4661-aab1-0824fb5237c3.command: walk me through setting up SSH keys

guide.command: walk me through setting up SSH keys
guide.intro: Setting up SSH keys is crucial for secure, passwordless authentication to remote servers. This guide will walk you through generating, configuring, and using SSH keys on macOS, explaining the importance of each step.

steps.title: Open Terminal
steps.explanation: We start by opening the Terminal application, which is essential for executing commands to manage SSH keys. Terminal provides direct access to the operating system's command line interface.
steps.code: const { keyboard, Key } = require('@nut-tree-fork/nut-js'); const { findAndClick } = require('../src/services/visionSpatialService'); console.log('[GUIDE STEP 1] Opening Terminal application...'); await findAndClick('terminal_icon.png'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Generate SSH Key
steps.explanation: Generating an SSH key pair is the first step in setting up secure authentication. The key pair consists of a private key (kept secret) and a public key (shared with servers). This command creates a new key pair using RSA encryption.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 2] Generating SSH key...'); await keyboard.type('ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));

steps.title: Save SSH Key
steps.explanation: You'll be prompted to save the key. Pressing Enter without typing anything will save it to the default location (~/.ssh/id_rsa). This step is crucial as it determines where your private key will be stored.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 3] Saving SSH key...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

verification.expectedText: Enter file in which to save the key

steps.title: Set Passphrase
steps.explanation: Setting a passphrase adds an extra layer of security to your private key. It's optional but recommended for sensitive operations. If you choose not to set one, just press Enter twice.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 4] Setting passphrase for SSH key...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));

steps.title: Copy Public Key
steps.explanation: The public key needs to be copied to the clipboard for easy transfer to remote servers. This step uses the `pbcopy` command, which is specific to macOS, to copy the contents of the public key file.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 5] Copying public key to clipboard...'); await keyboard.type('cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | pbcopy'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

commonRecoveries.title: Install Terminal
commonRecoveries.explanation: Terminal is not installed or accessible on your system. You'll need to ensure it's available.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions: Terminal is a default application on macOS. If you can't find it, restart your computer or check in the Applications/Utilities folder.

commonRecoveries.title: Resolve Permission Issues
commonRecoveries.explanation: You don't have the necessary permissions to execute certain commands. This is common when trying to write to system directories.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Open Terminal
2. Type `sudo -s` and enter your password
3. Try the command again
4. If issues persist, contact your system administrator

guide.command: walk me through setting up SSH keys
guide.intro: SSH keys provide a secure way to authenticate with remote servers without using passwords. This guide will walk you through generating and configuring SSH keys on your macOS system, explaining each step and why it's important for secure remote access.

steps.title: Open Terminal
steps.explanation: To set up SSH keys, we first need to open the Terminal application. Terminal is a command-line interface where we'll run the commands to generate your SSH key pair. On macOS, Terminal is the built-in application for executing shell commands. You can find it manually by clicking Finder → Go → Applications → Utilities → Terminal, or by searching for 'Terminal' in Spotlight (Cmd+Space).
steps.code: const { keyboard, Key } = require('@nut-tree-fork/nut-js'); const { findAndClick } = require('../src/services/visionSpatialService'); console.log('[GUIDE STEP 1] Opening Terminal application to begin SSH key setup...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Terminal'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Generate SSH Key
steps.explanation: Now we'll generate your SSH key pair using the ssh-keygen command. This creates two files: a private key (id_rsa) that stays on your computer, and a public key (id_rsa.pub) that you'll share with servers. We're using RSA encryption with 4096 bits for strong security. To do this manually, simply type 'ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"' in Terminal and press Enter. You'll be prompted to choose a location (press Enter for default) and set a passphrase (optional but recommended for extra security).
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 2] Generating SSH key pair with RSA 4096-bit encryption...'); await keyboard.type('ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Accept Default Location
steps.explanation: The system is asking where to save your SSH key. The default location (~/.ssh/id_rsa) is recommended because most tools look for keys there automatically. When you see the prompt 'Enter file in which to save the key', simply press Enter to accept the default. If you're doing this manually, you'll see this prompt in Terminal after running ssh-keygen.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 3] Accepting default SSH key location (~/.ssh/id_rsa)...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));

steps.title: Set Passphrase (Optional)
steps.explanation: You're now prompted to set a passphrase for your SSH key. A passphrase adds an extra layer of security - even if someone gets your private key file, they can't use it without the passphrase. You'll see two prompts: 'Enter passphrase' and 'Enter same passphrase again'. For this guide, we'll skip the passphrase by pressing Enter twice, but in production you should type a strong passphrase and press Enter, then type it again and press Enter.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 4] Skipping passphrase for demonstration (press Enter twice)...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));

steps.title: View Public Key
steps.explanation: Your SSH key pair has been generated! Now we'll display your public key so you can copy it. The public key is what you'll add to GitHub, GitLab, or other services. To view it manually, type 'cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub' in Terminal and press Enter. The 'cat' command displays file contents, and the tilde (~) represents your home directory. You'll see a long string starting with 'ssh-rsa' - that's your public key.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 5] Displaying your public SSH key...'); await keyboard.type('cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

commonRecoveries.title: Install Terminal
commonRecoveries.explanation: Terminal is not installed on your system. This is highly unlikely on macOS, but if you're using a custom setup, you may need to install it.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Check if you're using a custom macOS setup
2. If so, install Terminal from the macOS installation media or contact your system administrator
3. Try this guide again

commonRecoveries.title: Resolve Permission Issues
commonRecoveries.explanation: You may not have the necessary permissions to generate SSH keys in the default location.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Open Terminal
2. Run 'sudo ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"' to generate the key with elevated permissions
3. Enter your administrator password when prompted
4. Try this guide again

commonRecoveries.title: Handle Timeout
commonRecoveries.explanation: The operation took longer than expected, possibly due to system load or network issues.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Wait for a few minutes and try the guide again
2. If the issue persists, restart your computer and try again
3. Check your internet connection if applicable

commonRecoveries.title: Verify Terminal Opened
commonRecoveries.explanation: The guide couldn't verify that Terminal opened successfully.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Manually open Terminal by clicking Finder → Go → Applications → Utilities → Terminal
2. Try the guide again from the 'Generate SSH Key' step

commonRecoveries.title: Resolve Execution Error
commonRecoveries.explanation: An error occurred while executing the code. This could be due to a variety of issues.
commonRecoveries.manualInstructions:
1. Check if you have the latest version of Nut.js installed
2. Ensure you have the necessary permissions
3. Try the guide again
4. If the issue persists, contact support

commonRecoveries.explanation: The expected UI element was not found, indicating that the SSH key generation might not have completed successfully.

2. If it's a syntax error, correct the command and try again
3. If it's a system configuration issue, consult the relevant documentation or seek help online

guide.command: show me how to build a product on Amazon.com
guide.intro: Creating a product listing on Amazon.com allows you to reach millions of potential customers worldwide. This guide will walk you through the process of building a product listing on Amazon, explaining each step and why it's important. By the end, you'll have a complete product listing ready to go live on Amazon's marketplace.

steps.title: Open Web Browser
steps.explanation: To start building your product on Amazon, we need to open a web browser. A web browser is essential for accessing Amazon's seller central where you'll create your product listing. You can manually open your preferred browser by clicking on its icon on your dock or in your applications folder. Alternatively, press Cmd+Space to open Spotlight, type the name of your browser (e.g., 'Safari'), and press Enter.
steps.code: const { keyboard, Key } = require('@nut-tree-fork/nut-js'); const { findAndClick } = require('../src/services/visionSpatialService'); console.log('[GUIDE STEP 1] Opening web browser to access Amazon Seller Central...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Safari'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Navigate to Amazon Seller Central
steps.explanation: Now that the browser is open, we need to navigate to Amazon Seller Central. This is where you'll manage your product listings. You can manually type 'sellercentral.amazon.com' into the address bar and press Enter, or click on a bookmark if you have one set up. Amazon Seller Central is the platform where you'll input all your product details.

guide.command: Teach me how to take links from perplexity and use ticket.thinkdrop.ai to make a video on cooking in google notebook LM
guide.intro: In this guide, you'll learn how to extract cooking recipe links from Perplexity, use ticket.thinkdrop.ai to create a video, and save it in Google NotebookLM. This process combines web research, AI video generation, and note-taking, which are essential skills for content creation and organization.

steps.title: Open Perplexity
steps.explanation: We'll start by opening Perplexity to search for cooking recipes. Perplexity is an AI-powered search engine that provides comprehensive answers and links to relevant content. You can manually open it by clicking on your desktop, navigating to your applications folder, and selecting Perplexity, or by searching for 'Perplexity' in Spotlight (Cmd+Space). This step is crucial as it's where we'll find the recipe links we need for our video.
steps.code: const { keyboard, Key } = require('@nut-tree-fork/nut-js'); const { findAndClick } = require('../src/services/visionSpatialService'); console.log('[GUIDE STEP 1] Opening Perplexity to search for cooking recipes...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Perplexity'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));

steps.title: Search for Cooking Recipes
steps.explanation: Now, we'll search for cooking recipes in Perplexity. Typing 'cooking recipes' into the search bar will help us find relevant links. Perplexity's AI will provide a list of recipes along with links to detailed instructions. You can manually type this into the search bar at the top of the Perplexity window. This step is important because it gathers the content we'll use to create our video.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 2] Searching for cooking recipes in Perplexity...'); await findAndClick('perplexity_search_bar'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('cooking recipes'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));

steps.title: Copy Recipe Link
steps.explanation: We need to copy a recipe link from the search results. Right-clicking on a link and selecting 'Copy Link Address' will save it to your clipboard. This link will be used in ticket.thinkdrop.ai to generate our video. You can manually do this by hovering over a recipe link, right-clicking, and choosing 'Copy Link Address' from the context menu. This step ensures we have the content needed for our video creation.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 3] Copying a recipe link from Perplexity search results...'); await findAndClick('recipe_link'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.RightControl, Key.KeyC); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.RightControl, Key.KeyC); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));

steps.title: Open ticket.thinkdrop.ai
steps.explanation: Next, we'll open ticket.thinkdrop.ai to create our video. This platform uses AI to generate videos from text or links. You can manually open it by navigating to your web browser, typing 'ticket.thinkdrop.ai' in the address bar, and pressing Enter. This step is essential as it's where we'll transform our recipe link into a video.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 4] Opening ticket.thinkdrop.ai to create a video from the recipe link...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Chrome'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000)); await keyboard.type('ticket.thinkdrop.ai'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 3000));

steps.title: Paste Recipe Link and Generate Video
steps.explanation: We'll now paste the recipe link into ticket.thinkdrop.ai and generate a video. Right-clicking in the input field and selecting 'Paste' will insert the link. Then, we'll click the 'Generate' button to create our video. You can manually do this by right-clicking in the input field, choosing 'Paste', and then clicking the 'Generate' button. This step is crucial as it converts our recipe into a visual format.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 5] Pasting recipe link and generating video in ticket.thinkdrop.ai...'); await findAndClick('input_field'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.RightControl, Key.KeyV); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.RightControl, Key.KeyV); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000)); await findAndClick('generate_button'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));

steps.title: Open Google NotebookLM
steps.explanation: We'll open Google NotebookLM to save our video. Google NotebookLM is a note-taking app that allows you to organize and save various types of content. You can manually open it by navigating to your web browser, typing 'notebooklm.google.com' in the address bar, and pressing Enter. This step is important as it's where we'll store our video for future reference.

steps.title: Create New Note and Add Video
steps.explanation: Finally, we'll create a new note in Google NotebookLM and add our video. Clicking the 'New Note' button will start a new note, and then we'll paste the video link into the note. You can manually do this by clicking 'New Note', right-clicking in the note area, and selecting 'Paste'. This step is essential for organizing and saving our created content for later use.

guide.command: Teach me how to take links from perplexity to make a cooking video in notebook LM
guide.intro: This guide will teach you how to take links from Perplexity to create a cooking video in Notebook LM. This process is useful for transforming research or recipe ideas into visual content, enhancing your learning and sharing capabilities. We'll automate the steps using Nut.js, ensuring you understand each part of the process while executing it.

steps.title: Open Perplexity
steps.explanation: We'll start by opening the Perplexity application to access the links you want to use for your cooking video. Perplexity is a search engine that provides comprehensive answers and links to further resources. You can open it manually by clicking on the Perplexity icon in your Applications folder or by searching for 'Perplexity' in Spotlight (Cmd+Space). This step is crucial as it sets the foundation for gathering the necessary information.
steps.code: const { keyboard, Key } = require('@nut-tree-fork/nut-js'); const { findAndClick } = require('../src/services/visionSpatialService'); console.log('[GUIDE STEP 1] Opening Perplexity to gather links for your cooking video...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Perplexity'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Copy Link from Perplexity
steps.explanation: Now, we'll copy a link from Perplexity that you want to use in your cooking video. This step is important because it allows us to transfer the information from Perplexity to Notebook LM. You can manually select the link by clicking on it, then right-clicking and choosing 'Copy Link Address'. This link will serve as the source material for your video.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 2] Copying a link from Perplexity for your cooking video...'); await findAndClick('perplexity_link'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftControl, Key.C); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftControl, Key.C); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));

steps.title: Open Notebook LM
steps.explanation: Next, we'll open Notebook LM, where you'll create your cooking video. Notebook LM is a tool that allows you to create and edit videos directly from your computer. You can open it manually by clicking on the Notebook LM icon in your Applications folder or by searching for 'Notebook LM' in Spotlight (Cmd+Space). This step is essential for transitioning from research to content creation.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 3] Opening Notebook LM to create your cooking video...'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftSuper, Key.Space); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500)); await keyboard.type('Notebook LM'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Paste Link into Notebook LM
steps.explanation: We'll now paste the link you copied from Perplexity into Notebook LM. This step is crucial for integrating the research material into your video project. You can manually paste the link by right-clicking in the appropriate field in Notebook LM and selecting 'Paste'. This action will allow Notebook LM to process the link and prepare it for your video.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 4] Pasting the link into Notebook LM for your cooking video...'); await findAndClick('notebook_lm_paste_field'); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.LeftControl, Key.V); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.LeftControl, Key.V); await keyboard.pressKey(Key.Return); await keyboard.releaseKey(Key.Return); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));

steps.title: Create Cooking Video
steps.explanation: Finally, we'll create your cooking video in Notebook LM using the link you've pasted. Notebook LM will process the link and generate a video based on the content. You can manually initiate this by clicking on the 'Create Video' button in Notebook LM. This step is the culmination of your research and preparation, turning your gathered information into a visual format that can be shared and enjoyed.
steps.code: console.log('[GUIDE STEP 5] Creating your cooking video in Notebook LM...'); await findAndClick('notebook_lm_create_video'); await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));
